content.raw:
The SpawnDropBullet test introduced by pull request #217 fails because the box and cylinder bounce to the side when they hit the ground. The cylinder bounces far enough to exceed the error tolerances. I expect there is a solver parameter related to the split impulse that can fix this.
~~~
[ RUN      ] PhysicsTest.SpawnDropBullet

Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

Msg Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
Msg Publicized address: 192.168.1.67
Dbg Check freefall of model test_box
Dbg Check freefall of model test_sphere
Dbg Check freefall of model test_cylinder
Dbg Check ground contact of model test_box
Dbg Check ground contact of model test_sphere
Dbg Check ground contact of model test_cylinder
/home/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/regression/physics.cc:174: Failure
The difference between pose1.pos.x and x0 is 0.010209083557128906, which exceeds 1e-2, where
pose1.pos.x evaluates to 8.0102090835571289,
x0 evaluates to 8, and
1e-2 evaluates to 0.01.
[  FAILED  ] PhysicsTest.SpawnDropBullet (3065 ms)
~~~
content.html:
The SpawnDropBullet test introduced by pull request #217 fails because the box and cylinder bounce to the side when they hit the ground. The cylinder bounces far enough to exceed the error tolerances. I expect there is a solver parameter related to the split impulse that can fix this.
